sentences.en: A private , neutral person chosen to arbitrate a disagreement, as opposed to a court of law.
sentences.cn: 被挑选来仲裁分歧的中立的个人, 与法庭相对.

sentences.en: Dictionaries also can arbitrate disputes that arise during a game of Scrabble or late - night conversations.
sentences.cn: 字典也可以仲裁拼字游戏或午夜谈话中出现的争执.

sentences.en: Do not solve, can arbitrate to local labor dispute committee appeal.
sentences.cn: 解决不成的, 可向当地劳动争议仲裁委员会申诉.

sentences.en: Evaluate the certificate, fulfill contract, claim, judge, arbitrate to provide the valid basis for the client.
sentences.cn: 评估证书, 为委托人履约 、 索赔 、 审判 、 仲裁提供有效依据.

sentences.en: France was asked to arbitrate the dispute between the two nations.
sentences.cn: 法国受委托调停该两国间的纷争.

sentences.en: He arbitrates between investors and members of the association.
sentences.cn: 他在投资者与该协会成员之间做仲裁。

sentences.en: He cannot arbitrate, because he is interested in the matter.
sentences.cn: 他不能做仲裁, 因为他与这事有牵连.

sentences.en: He was asked to arbitrate between management and the unions.
sentences.cn: 他被邀请在资方与工会之间做出仲裁.

sentences.en: I cannot arbitrate, being interested in the matter.
sentences.cn: 由于我与这事有利害关系,因此不能作仲裁.

sentences.en: Mr. Smith has been asked to arbitrate between the employers and their workers.
sentences.cn: 已经请了史密斯先生来仲裁雇主与工人之间的纷争.

sentences.en: On the International Conventions of Recognition and Execution of Commercial Arbitrate Awards.
sentences.cn: 承认与执行国际商事仲裁裁决国际公约述评.

sentences.en: Paul will not continue to arbitrate their arguments.
sentences.cn: 保罗不会继续替他们的吵架做和事佬吧.

sentences.en: The tribunal had been set up to arbitrate in the dispute.
sentences.cn: 曾设立过特别法庭对此纷争作出仲裁。

sentences.en: They agreed to arbitrate their dispute.
sentences.cn: 他们同意经仲裁解决争端.

sentences.en: What is The Advantages for the Parties from Mainland in China to Arbitrate in HongKong? thx!
sentences.cn: 如果选择香港仲裁.对内地当事人有哪些优势 呢 ?谢谢!

sentences.en: You have prestige, and so are in a position to arbitrate.
sentences.cn: 你有脸, 这事得由你出面去调停.

trans.tran_en: to officially judge how an argument between two opposing sides should be settled
